skill.name: k8s-manifest-generator
skill.description: Create production-ready Kubernetes manifests for Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, and Secrets following best practices and security standards. Use when generating Kubernetes YAML manifests, creating K8s resources, or implementing production-grade Kubernetes configurations.
skill.summary: Create production-ready Kubernetes manifests for Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, and Secrets foll...

security_audit.summary: No data theft patterns or malicious execution behaviors found. The files are documentation and templates for Kubernetes manifests only.

content.value_statement: Kubernetes YAML is easy to get wrong and hard to standardize. This skill provides ready templates and best practices for production manifests.
actual_capabilities: Provides deployment manifest structure with probes, resources, and security contexts
Offers service templates for ClusterIP, LoadBalancer, NodePort, and headless services
Includes ConfigMap templates for key value, file, and JSON configs
Guides creation of Secrets and PersistentVolumeClaims
Lists validation steps using kubectl and common lint tools
limitations: Does not apply manifests to a cluster
Does not generate Helm charts or Kustomize files
Does not manage secret encryption or external secret stores
Does not validate against a live cluster state

use_cases.title: Standardize app manifests
use_cases.description: Create consistent Deployment and Service files with security and resource best practices.

use_cases.title: Bootstrap a new service
use_cases.description: Generate initial Kubernetes manifests for a new microservice quickly.

use_cases.title: Audit YAML patterns
use_cases.description: Compare team manifests against recommended probe and security settings.

prompt_templates.title: Basic web app
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a simple deployment and service
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Deployment and ClusterIP Service for app name web-api using image repo/web:1.2.3 and port 8080.

prompt_templates.title: Config and secrets
prompt_templates.prompt: Create manifests for app billing with ConfigMap keys and a Secret reference, plus Deployment and Service.

prompt_templates.title: Stateful workload
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a StatefulSet or Deployment with a PersistentVolumeClaim for app reports using 20Gi storage.

prompt_templates.title: Hardened production
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate production manifests with resource limits, probes, non root security context, and Prometheus annotations.

output_examples.input: Create production manifests for a payments API with image registry/payments:2.1.0, port 8080, and external access.
output: Deployment with three replicas, resource limits, and health probes
Security context set to non root with dropped capabilities

best_practices: Provide exact image tags and resource limits
State required ports and exposure type
Mention config and secret needs clearly
anti_patterns: Requesting secrets to be written in plain text
Using latest image tags in production
Skipping probes for long running services

faq.question: Is this compatible with any Kubernetes version
faq.answer: The templates target stable Kubernetes APIs and should work on most current clusters.

faq.question: What limits exist for manifest size or complexity
faq.answer: There is no enforced limit, but large multi resource files may need manual organization.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Helm or Kustomize
faq.answer: It provides YAML templates only, so you must integrate them manually.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data
faq.answer: No, it only generates guidance and templates within the conversation.

faq.question: What if the YAML fails validation
faq.answer: Use kubectl dry run and lint tools listed in the guidance to identify issues.

faq.question: How does it compare to a generator tool
faq.answer: This skill focuses on best practice guidance, not automated scaffolding or cluster interaction.
